title: Kanye West to tour ‘right away’ as new album Jesus Is King finally drops
text:
Kanye West’s new album Jesus Is King is out now (Picture: BACKGRID)

Kanye West fans, this is not a drill: the rapper is hitting the live circuit again.

In fact, the star insists he’ll tour ‘right away’ following the release of blockbuster new album Jesus Is King.

The rapper, who hasn’t toured in three years, finally dropped the religion-themed project – featuring songs like Follow God and Closed on Sunday – yesterday.

Asked by TMZ if he’ll tour the album, the husband of Kim Kardashian replied: ‘Right away.’

Kanye last toured in 2016 to promote the album The Life of Pablo.

Discussing his spiritual journey at a listening party in Washington, D. C. earlier this month, he told a crowd: ‘I want to let you know that I am not here for your entertainment this afternoon.

Kanye, pictured with wife Kim, is hitting the road for his new album (Picture: Rex Features)

‘We are here to spread the gospel.’

‘Excuse me if I mispronounce anything. I am a recent convert. It means I recently got saved within the year.’

Kanye’s pastor Adam Tyson recently offered further insight into Kanye’s faith, telling the Pure Flix Podcast: ‘If somebody cusses in his presence, I’ve heard him say a couple of times, “Hey, man, you can’t cuss when you’re with me. I’m a born-again Christian.”

‘Who’s gonna say that if they’re not meaning that they want Christ to be exalted in all that they do?’

Kanye has been speaking out about his religious journey of late. (Picture: Getty Images)

Meanwhile, the dad-of-four has also been opening up about his political ambitions this week – and it seems he’s still eyeing up the top job.

The star told Apple Music’s Zane Lowe: ‘There will be a time when I will be President of the United States.

‘And I will remember… any founder that didn’t have the capacity to understand culturally what we’re doing.’
